title: What is the best song ever to wake up to? - Quora

response.answer_text: I have a couple playlists that I choose from… I change the playlist each week. They include… Metal: Rage Against the Machine, White Zombie, Korn, Pantera, Metallica, and Megadeth Classic Rock: Aerosmith, Black Sabbath, AC/DC, The Rolling Stones, The Beatles, The Who, Led Zeppelin, and The Grateful Dead Reggae-ish: Bob Marley and Sublime Punk Rock: Green Day, The Clash, The Offspring, The Ramones, and Social Distortion Grunge/Alt : Alice In Chains, Soundgarden, Stone Temple Pilots, Nirvana, The Toadies, 311, Pearl Jam, Nine Inch Nails, and Dinosaur Jr. Indie: The Honeysticks, Hippo Campus, The Black Keys, Peach Pit, Summer Salt, Feng Suave, Boy Pablo, Clap Your Hands Say Yeah, Far Caspian, Weezer, Arcade Fire, Gorillaz, Foster the People, Grouplove, Radiohead, Muse, Neutral Milk Hotel, Alt-J, Modest Mouse, Glass Animals, Arctic Monkeys, Cage the Elephant, and MGMT Rap: Notorious B.I.G., 2Pac, Ice Cube, Black Sheep, Eminem, Run DMC, and Salt N’ Pepper Weird: Primus, Sigur Ros, Dave Matthews Band, B-52’s, Beck, The White Stripes, Gnarls Barkley, Jane’s Addiction, Porno for Pyros, Korn, The Mighty Mighty Bosstones, Reel Big Fish, Jack White, Jack Stauber, Rusted Root, Soul Coughing, Santana I still left out a bunch but this is enough. Basically… I like to wake up to all music from a lot of genres except pop. It’s just to poppy for me.

Oh that’s a fun question. There isn’t any single style or artist I always use. I do use music in the morning to get my mind and body running. Often I put on some live music on YouTube if I am sitting at my desk. I like to watch classic Grateful Dead concerts. Or I’ll choose a playlist from Spotify or iTunes. 95% of the time it’s a playlist I have made but sometimes I use one generated for me by the streaming service. Sometimes I go for harder edged rock if I need a quick and jarring jolt awake such as: AC/DC or Led Zeppelin. Sometimes I want to hear gifted musicians ranging from the blue eyed soul of Daryl Hall to the musical perfection of Steely Dan. Sometimes I have an upcoming concert and play that artist ranging from pop like Taylor Swift, country rock like Lady Antebellum, hippie music like Dead and Company, recent discoveries like The Revivalists, or new music from long time faves like Jack White. If I need to reminisce I may play Linda Ronstadt, Joni Mitchell, Simon and Garfunkel, Van Morrison… sometimes I go for classical (usually something like Mozart).I explore great guitar players both famous or new discoveries like Lari Basilio. I often go for my comfort bands like Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers. The important thing is to play things that suit your mood. Sometimes you want to fire your imagination or smooth your soul. Sometimes you want to blast yourself into a higher level of energy, or slow your mind down when it is racing too fast. For me I want music I need the foreground while I drink coffee, but once in a while I just need something I like playing in the background. My point is I don’t think there are any rules. One person’s preferences might not work for another. Your preferences one day may be totally inappropriate on a different day. To quote the Grateful Dead: “when you get confused listen to the music play.”
